messages.content: comfy-mecha is a complete model merging node pack for ComfyUI that focuses on low memory footprint.
What can users do with comfy-mecha?
With comfy-mecha, users can compose complex recipes without saving dozens of intermediate merges to disk, merge loras to models, and use block weights.
How can users install comfy-mecha using ComfyUI-Manager?
To install comfy-mecha using ComfyUI-Manager, open a browser tab on ComfyUI, click on the 'Manager' button, click on 'Install Custom Nodes', search for 'mecha', and install 'Mecha Merge Node Pack'.
What are the two main types of nodes in comfy-mecha?
The two main types of nodes in comfy-mecha are Merge nodes and Hyper nodes.
What does the 'Mecha Merger' node do?
The 'Mecha Merger' node takes a MECHA_RECIPE as input and returns a unet and a text encoder.
How can users add custom merge nodes to comfy-mecha?

Users can add custom merge nodes by placing python scripts that use the mecha extension API under the 'mecha_extensions' directory. The node pack will run all scripts placed there before creating the comfy nodes.
Where can users find more information about the mecha extension API?

Currently, the documentation for the mecha extension API is under construction. Users can refer to the custom merge method example, open a discussion post to ask questions, or join the discord server for more information.
